intro: Scabiosa flavescens, commonly known as the yellow scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and grasslands. Its nectar-rich flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
